org.eMayor.ServiceHandling.PrintingUtility.ejb
Class PrintingUtility

java.lang.Object
  org.eMayor.ServiceHandling.PrintingUtility.ejb.PrintingUtility

public class PrintingUtility
extends java.lang.Object

Prints TEXT, HTML, RTF, GIF, JPEG, PCL, PDF, POSTSCRIPT
TEXT, HTML, RTF are printed as rendered by JEditorPane

Author:
imavr

Constructor Detail

PrintingUtility

public PrintingUtility(java.lang.String Url,
                       java.io.InputStream propsIS,
                       java.lang.String filetypeName)
                throws javax.print.PrintException
Creates a new instance of PrintingUtlity

Parameters:
Url - The URL to be printed.
For printing a local html file the URL must be formated as: "file:///path/filename"
propsIS - An InputStream to the printing properties file
filetypeName - The filetype that determines how the InputStream will be rendered
can be:
"unknown" (uses PAGEABLE, PRINTABLE or RENDERABLE_IMAGE DocFlavor)
"text" (attemps to print plain text - no control over page layout is applied)
"text/plain" (attemps to print text rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"html" (attemps to print html rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"text/html" (attemps to print html rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"rtf" (attemps to print rtf rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"text/rtf" (attemps to print rtf rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"GIF" (uses GIF DocFlavor)
"JPEG" (uses JPEG DocFlavor)
"PCL" (uses PCL DocFlavor)
"PDF" (uses PDF DocFlavor)
"POSTSCRIPT" (uses POSTSCRIPT DocFlavor)
Throws:
javax.print.PrintException
Method Detail

print

public void print()
           throws javax.print.PrintException
Prints the content defined in the constructor according to its filetype.
The Print Dialog can be used is the "USEDIALOG" property is set to "true" in the properties file.
For ""text/plain", "html", "text/html", "rtf" and "text/rtf" file types HTMLPrinter is used.

Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

setDocProperies

public java.util.Properties setDocProperies(java.io.InputStream propsIS)
                                     throws javax.print.PrintException
Reads the properties file (declared in the constructor)

Parameters:
propsFilename - the properties path/file (being called by the constructor, it is passed the filename set in it)
Returns:
the properties read from the properties file
Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

isSupportedFileType

public boolean isSupportedFileType(java.lang.String lfiletypestr)
Check for the supported file types
File type is important for proper printing.
supported filetypes are:
"unknown" (uses PAGEABLE, PRINTABLE or RENDERABLE_IMAGE DocFlavor)
"text" (attemps to print plain text - no control over page layout is applied)
"text/plain" (attemps to print text rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"html" (attemps to print html rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"text/html" (attemps to print html rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"rtf" (attemps to print rtf rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"text/rtf" (attemps to print rtf rendered in JEditorPane - control over page layout is applied)
"GIF" (uses GIF DocFlavor)
"JPEG" (uses JPEG DocFlavor)
"PCL" (uses PCL DocFlavor)
"PDF" (uses PDF DocFlavor)
"POSTSCRIPT" (uses POSTSCRIPT DocFlavor)

Parameters:
lfiletypestr - the declared filetype
Returns:
true or false

getDefaultPrintService

public javax.print.PrintService getDefaultPrintService()
Discovers the default Print Service

Returns:
the default Print Service

getAvailablePrintServices

public javax.print.PrintService[] getAvailablePrintServices()
Discovers the printers that can print the requested DocFlavor
with the requested PrintRequestAttribyteSet (as defined in the properties file of by the PrintDialog)

Returns:
The available Print Services (that are compatible with the requested DocFlavor and PrintRequestAttribyteSet)

getPrintServices

public javax.print.PrintService[] getPrintServices()
                                            throws javax.print.PrintException
Discovers the printers that can print with the requested PrintRequestAttribyteSet, compromising attributes if necessary

Returns:
The available Print Services (that are compatible with the requested PrintRequestAttribyteSet - compromising attributes if necessary)
Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

Creates a Print Job from the specified PrintService

Parameters:
ps - the selected Print Service (usually returned from getPrintServices())
Returns:
DocPrintJob

printJob

public void printJob(javax.print.DocPrintJob dpj,
                     javax.print.Doc d)
              throws javax.print.PrintException
Prints the Print Job to the specified printService according to the specified PrintRequestAttributeSet

Parameters:
dpj - The created DocPrintJob
d - The Doc to be printed
Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

setRequest

public void setRequest()
                throws javax.print.PrintException
Creates the PrintRequestAttributeSet for the Print Service with the attributes specified in the properties file
and filters its attibutes to create the document-specific DocAttributeSet
by calling the PrintRequestAttributeSet2DocAttributeSet method.

Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

PrintRequestAttributeSet2DocAttributeSet

public javax.print.attribute.DocAttributeSet PrintRequestAttributeSet2DocAttributeSet(javax.print.attribute.PrintRequestAttributeSet pras)
Filters the attibutes of a PrintRequestAttributeSet to create the document-specific DocAttributeSet

Parameters:
pras - The PrintRequestAttributeSet to be converted to DocAttributeSet
Returns:
The DocAttributeSet converted from the specified PrintRequestAttributeSet

deriveMediaPrintableArea

public javax.print.attribute.standard.MediaPrintableArea deriveMediaPrintableArea()
Calculates the media printable area according to the size, orientation and margins set in the properties file

Returns:
The MediaPrintableArea

setDocFlavor

public void setDocFlavor()
Sets Document Flavor Type (DocFlavor) which will be used by PrintServiceLookup and also to create a Doc for Print Service.

printHtmlJob

public void printHtmlJob()
                  throws javax.print.PrintException
Uses HTMLPrinter to print "text/plain", "html" ("text/html") and rtf ("text/rtf") content

Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

createFinalDoc

public javax.print.Doc createFinalDoc(java.io.InputStream inStr)
Creates a Doc for printing. SimpleDoc is used.

Parameters:
inStr - the IputStream to be printed
Returns:
The Doc to be printed

Removes the requested attributes from the set to get atleast one Print Service

Parameters:
n - The attribute to be compromised
